summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The City of Dallas will hold a Special Called Joint Meeting of the Economic Development Committee and the Workforce, Education, and Equity Committee on March 4, 2024, at 3:30 PM. The meeting will take place in the Council Chambers on the 6th floor of City Hall and will also be available for public attendance via video conference.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The primary focus of the meeting will be a briefing on the "Historic and Cultural Preservation Strategy," which will introduce the draft of this strategy. Presenters include Andrea Gilles and Arturo del Castillo from the Department of Planning and Urban Design.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will cover the draft strategy aimed at preserving Dallas's historic and cultural assets. This initiative is part of broader efforts to enhance community engagement and equity in development practices. The meeting will be broadcast live on local cable channels and online, ensuring accessibility for the public.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek feedback on the draft strategy and may discuss potential recommendations for its implementation. No formal decisions or approvals are indicated in the agenda, but input from committee members and the public will be essential for shaping the final strategy.
